As to imitation; Poetry is a
mimetic art. It creates, but it creates
by combination & representation. Poetical
abstractions are beautiful & new, not
portions
because they had no previous the parts
of which they are composed had no
previous existence in the mind of man
or of in nature, but because the whole
by their combination
which [these] parts produced has some
[?as] they
intelligible & beautiful analogy with
those sources of emotion & thought.
One great Poet is a masterpiece
which another
of nature , not only ought to study
but must study. He [\] He might
as wisely & as easily determine that
his mind should no longer be the
monstrous
mirror of th all that is lovely —in
